hints.content:
The first set of blocks shows $\purpleD2$ hundreds, $\purpleD1$ ten, and $\purpleD8$ ones so, our first addend is $\purpleD{218}$.

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/5b8e8445f9a6a543f7ea43fb2125ca4c598ce81a)

The second set of blocks shows $\maroonD4$ hundreds, $\maroonD9$ tens, and $\maroonD5$ ones so, our second addend is $\maroonD{495}$.

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/006511b80f2c88cc10f9a356cf7a7e1ac392810f)

We can put our two numbers together on the place value chart.

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/f2bbc7c15cd54627c9ec7475552b63445814228d)

There are $6\text{ hundreds}, 10\text{ tens}$ and $13\text{ ones}$.

Next we can take our $13\text{ ones}$ and make $1\text{ ten}$ and $3\text{ ones}$.

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/a03dcf9cf34287da974d4a1df7c32b8e4288d6dc)

Now we can take our $11\text{ tens}$ and make $1\text{ hundred}$ and $1\text{ ten}$.

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/93b70271cd212b2aa91e9fe8448447ce4e3d6da3)

Together, there are $\blueE7$ hundreds, $\blueE1$ ten, and $\blueE3$ ones.

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/ce28abd2589de92b12ff51c4d9c3912d1ba73049)

$700 + 10 +3 =\blueE{713}$

This equation represents the place value blocks:

$\purpleE{218} + \maroonD{495} = \blueE{713}$

question.content:
**Which equation can be represented by the place value blocks below?**

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/96ba7e7a47b7701c8a7134a0d5968fd7f40bd0dc)

[[☃ radio 1]]
